comment: Straight forward course, weekly assignments to show what we are doing in our internships. A few other assignments spread out the semester like evaluations, these will be split in weekly modules. Easy A.

It is a law course so the material will seem like a lot, but it is manageable with Professor Horsey. The workload is spread into weekly modules and tests are not done with lockdown. Getting in contact with her is very quick, she's a great professor to teach this course.

I like this professor bc its an easy A, but get ready to pull your hair out bc she says the word um about every 4 words that come out of her mouth. If youre the type of person who is like me (a little bit picky) then this will drive you crazy and cause you to start counting how many times she says it than actually listening to the lecture
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: No exams, only weekly vocabulary and occasional guest speaker assignments. Easy but boring class since it is an intro to the major. Great professor.

A lot of these reviews say Dr. Horsey is boring, however you have to think about what she's teaching. It's an intro class, the material she's required to teach us is BORING. Love her efforts though. Easy professor! Easy grader! Definitely recommend compared to the other Kennesaw professors!!!

This class is a drag. Its not hard, but abunch of lectures. Guest speakers. Some speakers bring pizza. You will have in class labs you have to participate in to pass. They arent hard. Also make sure to do the weekly vocab. Shes really nice. Ive only take her for 1000.
As long as you show up to class every day and participate in her lectures enough for her to recognize you, she will do whatever it takes for you to end with an A. She is a great and caring professor!
Easy class. She's laidback and cares about her students. Homework was easy. No tests in her class. Easy A.

Prof. Horseys class is kind of boring because its lecture heavy by the class is really easy. As long as you do your vocab from the book youll be fine. There are no tests but there is classwork she begins near the end of the semester. Lots of CM companies come and speak to the class so its great for exposure and one company brings pizza!

OK teacher but just reads verbatim from slides. No reason to go except for class labs (which she adds more of when people stop showing up). Easy class/teacher but honestly doesn't seem to know what she's talking about even though she was in the industry. Also TONS of guest speakers and makes class really boring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy class. Only homework we had was vocal words directly out of the book every week. The book was found online for free so don't waste money buying it. easygoing and nice. she has guest speakers majority of the time and its helpful because she introduces you to people in the field of construction. a few in class assignments and no tests. EASY A!

1. very easy, like the only thing you're graded on is vocab homework once a week. 2. Has guest speaker like 75% of the time. 3. every once in awhile there is a in-class assignment. 4. attendance was mandatory for the first 5 weeks. after that it stopped. 5. there were no tests.
